datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: wifi

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

pre-auth.name: pre-auth
pre-auth.help: Enable/disable pre-authentication, where supported by clients (default = enable).

external-pre-auth.name: external-pre-auth
external-pre-auth.help: Enable/disable pre-authentication with external APs not managed by the FortiGate (default = disable).

mesh-backhaul.name: mesh-backhaul
mesh-backhaul.help: Enable/disable using this VAP as a WiFi mesh backhaul (default = disable). This entry is only available when security is set to a WPA type or open.

max-clients.name: max-clients
max-clients.help: Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP (default = 0, meaning no limitation).

max-clients-ap.name: max-clients-ap
max-clients-ap.help: Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP per AP radio (default = 0, meaning no limitation).

ssid.name: ssid
ssid.help: IEEE 802.11 service set identifier (SSID) for the wireless interface. Users who wish to use the wireless network must configure their computers to access this SSID name.

security.name: security
security.help: Security mode for the wireless interface (default = wpa2-only-personal).

options.description: Enable IPv6 ndp proxy - send back na on behalf of the client and drop the ns

options.name: drop-ns-dad
options.help: Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
options.label: Drop Ns Dad
options.description: Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache

options.name: drop-ns-nondad
options.help: Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
options.label: Drop Ns Nondad
options.description: Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache

ipv6-rules.default_value: drop-icmp6ra drop-icmp6rs drop-llmnr6 drop-icmp6mld2 drop-dhcp6s drop-dhcp6c ndp-proxy drop-ns-dad

me-disable-thresh.name: me-disable-thresh
me-disable-thresh.help: Disable multicast enhancement when this many clients are receiving multicast traffic.

probe-resp-suppression.name: probe-resp-suppression
probe-resp-suppression.help: Enable/disable probe response suppression (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).

probe-resp-threshold.name: probe-resp-threshold
probe-resp-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to probe requests (-95 to -20, default = -80).

radio-sensitivity.name: radio-sensitivity
radio-sensitivity.help: Enable/disable software radio sensitivity (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).

radio-5g-threshold.name: radio-5g-threshold
radio-5g-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 5G band(-95 to -20, default = -76).

radio-2g-threshold.name: radio-2g-threshold
radio-2g-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 2.4G band (-95 to -20, default = -79).

vlan-name.name: vlan-name
vlan-name.help: Table for mapping VLAN name to VLAN ID.

vlan-pooling.name: vlan-pooling
vlan-pooling.help: Enable/disable VLAN pooling, to allow grouping of multiple wireless controller VLANs into VLAN pools (default = disable). When set to wtp-group, VLAN pooling occurs with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.

options.name: wtp-group
options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
options.label: Wtp Group
options.description: Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group

options.name: round-robin
options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment.
options.label: Round Robin
options.description: Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment

options.name: hash
options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment.
options.label: Hash
options.description: Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment

dhcp-option43-insertion.name: dhcp-option43-insertion
dhcp-option43-insertion.help: Enable/disable insertion of DHCP option 43 (default = enable).

dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion.name: dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion
dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion.help: Enable/disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert (default = disable).

options.name: style-1
options.help: ASCII string composed of AP-MAC;SSID;SSID-TYPE. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx;wifi;s".
options.label: Style 1

options.name: style-2
options.help: ASCII string composed of AP-MAC. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
options.label: Style 2

dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion.name: dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion
dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion.help: Enable/disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert (default = disable).

options.name: style-1
options.help: ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device.
options.label: Style 1
options.description: ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device

ptk-rekey.name: ptk-rekey
ptk-rekey.help: Enable/disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security

gtk-rekey.name: gtk-rekey
gtk-rekey.help: Enable/disable GTK rekey for WPA security.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable GTK rekey for WPA security.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable GTK rekey for WPA security

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable GTK rekey for WPA security

eap-reauth.name: eap-reauth
eap-reauth.help: Enable/disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security

roaming-acct-interim-update.name: roaming-acct-interim-update
roaming-acct-interim-update.help: Enable/disable using accounting interim update instead of accounting start/stop on roaming for WPA-Enterprise security.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using accounting interim update on roaming for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable using accounting interim update on roaming for WPA-Enterprise security

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using accounting interim update on roaming for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable using accounting interim update on roaming for WPA-Enterprise security

primary-wag-profile.name: primary-wag-profile
primary-wag-profile.help: Primary wireless access gateway profile name.

secondary-wag-profile.name: secondary-wag-profile
secondary-wag-profile.help: Secondary wireless access gateway profile name.

tunnel-echo-interval.name: tunnel-echo-interval
tunnel-echo-interval.help: The time interval to send echo to both primary and secondary tunnel peers (1 - 65535 sec, default = 300).

tunnel-fallback-interval.name: tunnel-fallback-interval
tunnel-fallback-interval.help: The time interval for secondary tunnel to fall back to primary tunnel (0 - 65535 sec, default = 7200).

rates-11ac-mcs-map.name: rates-11ac-mcs-map
rates-11ac-mcs-map.help: Comma separated list of max supported VHT MCS for spatial streams 1 through 8.

rates-11ax-mcs-map.name: rates-11ax-mcs-map
rates-11ax-mcs-map.help: Comma separated list of max supported HE MCS for spatial streams 1 through 8.

rates-11be-mcs-map.name: rates-11be-mcs-map
rates-11be-mcs-map.help: Comma separated list of max nss that supports EHT-MCS 0-9, 10-11, 12-13 for 20MHz/40MHz/80MHz bandwidth.

rates-11be-mcs-map-160.name: rates-11be-mcs-map-160
rates-11be-mcs-map-160.help: Comma separated list of max nss that supports EHT-MCS 0-9, 10-11, 12-13 for 160MHz bandwidth.

rates-11be-mcs-map-320.name: rates-11be-mcs-map-320
rates-11be-mcs-map-320.help: Comma separated list of max nss that supports EHT-MCS 0-9, 10-11, 12-13 for 320MHz bandwidth.

utm-status.name: utm-status
utm-status.help: Enable to add one or more security profiles (AV, IPS, etc.) to the VAP.

scan-botnet-connections.name: scan-botnet-connections
scan-botnet-connections.help: Block or monitor connections to Botnet servers or disable Botnet scanning.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not scan connections to botnet servers.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Do not scan connections to botnet servers

address-group-policy.name: address-group-policy
address-group-policy.help: Configure MAC address filtering policy for MAC addresses that are in the address-group.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable MAC address filtering policy for MAC addresses that are in the address-group
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable MAC address filtering policy for MAC addresses that are in the address-group    allow:Allow clients with MAC addresses that are in the address-group

options.name: allow
options.help: Allow clients with MAC addresses that are in the address-group.
options.label: Allow

options.name: deny
options.help: Block clients with MAC addresses that are in the address-group.
options.label: Deny
options.description: Block clients with MAC addresses that are in the address-group

sticky-client-remove.name: sticky-client-remove
sticky-client-remove.help: Enable/disable sticky client remove to maintain good signal level clients in SSID (default = disable).

sticky-client-threshold-5g.name: sticky-client-threshold-5g
sticky-client-threshold-5g.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 5G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).

sticky-client-threshold-2g.name: sticky-client-threshold-2g
sticky-client-threshold-2g.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 2G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -79).

sticky-client-threshold-6g.name: sticky-client-threshold-6g
sticky-client-threshold-6g.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 6G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).

bstm-rssi-disassoc-timer.name: bstm-rssi-disassoc-timer
bstm-rssi-disassoc-timer.help: Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to low RSSI (0 to 2000, default = 200).

bstm-load-balancing-disassoc-timer.name: bstm-load-balancing-disassoc-timer
bstm-load-balancing-disassoc-timer.help: Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to AP load-balancing (0 to 30, default = 10).

bstm-disassociation-imminent.name: bstm-disassociation-imminent
bstm-disassociation-imminent.help: Enable/disable forcing of disassociation after the BSTM request timer has been reached (default = enable).

beacon-advertising.name: beacon-advertising
beacon-advertising.help: Fortinet beacon advertising IE data   (default = empty).

osen.name: osen
osen.help: Enable/disable OSEN as part of key management (default = disable).

application-dscp-marking.name: application-dscp-marking
application-dscp-marking.help: Enable/disable application attribute based DSCP marking (default = disable).

l3-roaming-mode.name: l3-roaming-mode
l3-roaming-mode.help: Select the way that layer 3 roaming traffic is passed (default = direct).

options.name: direct
options.help: Layer 3 roaming traffic is passed between home AP and guest AP directly.
options.label: Direct
options.description: Layer 3 roaming traffic is passed between home AP and guest AP directly

options.name: indirect
options.help: Layer 3 roaming traffic is passed between home AP and guest AP through controllers.
options.label: Indirect
options.description: Layer 3 roaming traffic is passed between home AP and guest AP through controllers
